flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Classical Pong game implemented on an Arduino Uno using a PCD8544 LCD screen which is better known as the Nokia 5110 screen.

Player bars are controlled by a potentiometer for each player. If you want the bar to go left, just turn the potentiometer left.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Classical Pong game implemented on an Arduino Uno using a PCD8544 LCD screen which is better known as the Nokia 5110 screen.

Player bars are controlled by a potentiometer for each player. If you want the bar to go left, just turn the potentiometer left.

Tools
  • Arduino Uno
  • Breadboard
  • Jumper Wire
  • PCD8544 LCD screen
  • Potentiometer, 5kΩ

lines.text: Connect the Arduino Uno, PCD8544 LCD screen and 2 potentiomaters as shown in the Fritzing diagram.
lines.text_raw: Connect the Arduino Uno, PCD8544 LCD screen and 2 potentiomaters as shown in the Fritzing diagram.

lines.text: Download the Arduino sketch (Pong.ino file) from https://github.com/monur/Arduino-Uno-PCD...
lines.text_raw: Download the Arduino sketch (Pong.ino file) from https://github.com/monur/Arduino-Uno-PCD8544-Pong

lines.text: Open Pong.ino sketch with Arduino IDE software
lines.text_raw: Open Pong.ino sketch with Arduino IDE software

lines.text: Connect the Arduino Uno to your computer with a USB cable.
lines.text_raw: Connect the Arduino Uno to your computer with a USB cable.

lines.text: In the Arduino IDE software menu, select Tools->Board->Arduino Uno
lines.text_raw: In the Arduino IDE software menu, select Tools->Board->Arduino Uno

lines.text: In the Arduino IDE menu, select File->Upload or use the shortcut key combination Ctrl-U
lines.text_raw: In the Arduino IDE menu, select File->Upload or use the shortcut key combination Ctrl-U

lines.text: The game starts in the LCD screen. You can control the bars using the potentiometers.
lines.text_raw: The game starts in the LCD screen. You can control the bars using the potentiometers.
